header.title: The best Fence & Concrete installation company in Oakland
bullets: Repair or replace your fence with a trusted fence company.
The best choice in Oakland for competitive pricing and quality craftsmanship.
Free custom quotes and dedicated customer service team.
Get the job done and your property looking great with our skilled local contractors!

Yelp.title: The ease of obtaining an estimate was great from start to finish. I was able to obtain an appointment very quickly which was followed up with a reminder text for the appointment. I spoke with Andy he was prompt professional and thorough. As a customer who knows nothing of the subject he made sure I understood all the ins and outs of what my estimate entailed and the different options available to me. The follow-up calls and information were great as well.
Yelp.name: Priscila B.
Yelp.description: The ease of obtaining an estimate was great from start to finish.

Google.title: I contacted Ergeon and received a call from their quote specialist. He set up an appointment with me on video to look at the fence and take measurements. It was a very pleasant experience. He could see everything as though he was there in person. He sent me a very reasonable quote. He put me in touch with the Project Manager who sent out the installers to come out. Once they got clearance from PGE they came out and installed my 60 feet fence in about 4 hours. I love my beautiful fence.
Google.name: Juan J.

regulations.title: Permits & Regulations
regulations.description: See the undefined Permits & Regulations for undefined

faq.front-yard: 3.5 feet, 6 feet with a "small project design review" (minimum 60% open)
faq.side-yard: 3.5 feet on street side, 8 feet on interior side yard, 6 feet if within 35' from the rear lot line or with a "small project design review" submittal
faq.rear-max-height: 8 feet, 6 feet if within 10 feet of a street side property line
faq.corner-lot-rules: Max 3 feet (above the street-pavement grade) on visibility area  along the property line for a distance, measured from the intersection of two property lines or their projection, which is equal to the sum of the building setbacks on each of the two intersecting streets, existing or legal, whichever is less. https://library.municode.com/ca/oakland/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=TIT10VETR_CH10.60VIOBIN

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.
